channel.title: Programming on Personal website
channel.description: Recent content in Programming on Personal website

item.title: Programming Example (1)
item.description:
I picked up the R programming language during my MSc at University of California San Diego, and use it constantly in my day-job, along with some Python. For fun I sometimes apply these tools to interesting-looking datasets that are lying around the web, and try to tell their stories through well-designed data visualisations. Some blog posts are mirrored on R-bloggers, a blogging community for the R language.

Useful bash one-liners useful for bioinformatics (and some, more generally useful).

Contents

  • Sources
  • Basic awk & sed
  • awk & sed for bioinformatics
  • sort, uniq, cut, etc.
  • find, xargs, and GNU parallel
  • seqtk
  • GFF3 Annotations
  • Other generally useful aliases for your .bashrc
  • Etc.
